Major_Arcs.title: The Circus Spectacle and Intrigue
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces a circus setting, featuring strongman Paul Bunyan and unfolding into a conflict involving threats, betrayal, and unexpected heroism within the circus environment.

sub_scenes.title: Circus Arrival and Strongman Introduction
sub_scenes.description: This scene introduces the circus setting and its performers, focusing on Paul Bunyan's strongman act and the arrival of excited spectators.

narrative_arcs.title: Circus Spectators Arrive and React to a Giraffe

sub_scenes.title: Confrontation with Billings
sub_scenes.description: This scene introduces conflict as spectators intervene in a threatening situation involving Billings, leading to a display of superhuman strength and danger.

narrative_arcs.title: Responding to a Cry for Help and Confronting Billings
Billings' Display of Superhuman Strength and Attack
Pistol Threat and Escalation of Danger

sub_scenes.title: Exposition and a New Opportunity
sub_scenes.description: The tension continues as threats persist, followed by exposition revealing the circus conflict's background and a proposition for a new strongman.

narrative_arcs.title: Continuing Threats from Billings and the Pistol Man
Exposition on Matto Grasso and Circus Conflict
Proposal to Become the New Strong Man

sub_scenes.title: Bunyan's Debut and Grasso's Revenge
sub_scenes.description: Paul Bunyan takes center stage as the new strongman while Matto Grasso plots revenge, leading to chaos and Bunyan's intervention.

narrative_arcs.title: Paul Bunyan's Debut and Grasso's Envy
Chase Enters the Arena and Paul Bunyan's Intervention

sub_scenes.title: Grasso's Downfall and Bunyan's Farewell
sub_scenes.description: The confrontation between Grasso and Sonny escalates, leading to Grasso's capture and Paul Bunyan's decision to leave the circus life behind.

narrative_arcs.title: Matto's Turn and Dominance in the Fight
The Trapeze Toss and Sonny's Protest
Sonny's Aerial Peril and Trapeze Rescue
Job Offer and Paul's Woodland Yearning

Major_Arcs.title: Marco Polo's Tibetan Adventure
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc details Marco Polo's fantastical adventures, starting with an encounter in Tibet, leading to a supernatural quest involving a talking severed head, a princess rescue, and a confrontation with a witch.

sub_scenes.title: Ogress of Tibet and Severed Head Discovery
sub_scenes.description: This scene introduces Marco Polo's legendary adventures and transitions to a gruesome discovery in Tibet: a talking severed head.

narrative_arcs.title: Marco Polo's Adventures and the Ogress of Tibet
Ghastly Discovery of a Severed Head

sub_scenes.title: Life Debt and Journey to Hi-toun
sub_scenes.description: The rescued man repays his rescuer with a magical dagger and directs him towards Hi-toun, where the city is in mourning.

narrative_arcs.title: Life Debt and a Sacred Dagger
Reason for Silence and Parting Ways
Arrival and Ominous Welcome to Hi-toun

sub_scenes.title: King's Plea and Witch's Castle
sub_scenes.description: Marco Polo learns of the missing princess and is then drawn into helping a distressed woman, leading him to a witch's castle.

narrative_arcs.title: The King's Plea for His Missing Daughter
A Desperate Mother and a Witch's Castle
Entering the Witch's Castle and Unveiling the 'Children'

sub_scenes.title: Ogress's Reveal and Escape
sub_scenes.description: The old woman reveals herself as the Ogress, leading to Marco's imprisonment and subsequent escape using the magical dagger.

narrative_arcs.title: Initial Fire Attack and Escape Attempt
The Fly Blade Attack and Ogress's Downfall

sub_scenes.title: Royal Reunion and Departure
sub_scenes.description: Marco Polo returns the woman to her father, the King, and despite being offered a reward, chooses to continue his adventures.

Major_Arcs.title: The Treasure of Agra and Revenge
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc tells a tale of treasure, betrayal, and revenge, set in a British penal colony and later in England, culminating in a deadly confrontation over stolen riches.

sub_scenes.title: Treasure Tale Introduction and Prison Plot
sub_scenes.description: A narrator introduces a tale of treasure as a prisoner in a penal colony plots with a Captain for escape and riches.

narrative_arcs.title: Captain Brooking's Inquiry to Officer Jordan

sub_scenes.title: Betrayal and Vow of Revenge
sub_scenes.description: The Captain betrays the prisoner, taking the treasure and leaving him behind, prompting a vow of revenge.

narrative_arcs.title: Return to England and Renewed Vengeance

sub_scenes.title: Deadly Confrontation in the Attic
sub_scenes.description: Years later, the prisoner returns to England seeking revenge, leading to a final, deadly confrontation over the treasure in an attic.

narrative_arcs.title: Confrontation and Capture of a Suspect
Police Observation and Homicide Squad Call
Moral of the Tale: Money as Evil

Major_Arcs.title: The Haunted Matthews Estate
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc follows Henry Northrup as he investigates a haunted estate, confronting a vengeful spirit and resolving the haunting through forgiveness and brotherly love.

sub_scenes.title: Introduction to the Haunted Estate
sub_scenes.description: Dr. Styx introduces the problem of the haunted Matthews estate to Henry Northrup, setting up the supernatural mystery.

narrative_arcs.title: Northrup's Expected Arrival and Supernatural Expertise
Eerie Warning at the Old House

sub_scenes.title: Confrontation with Vincent Matthews' Ghost
sub_scenes.description: Henry Northrup enters the haunted estate and immediately faces the vengeful spirit of Vincent Matthews, leading to a physical and psychological battle.

narrative_arcs.title: Entering the Haunted House and Confronting Vincent Matthews

sub_scenes.title: Resolution through Forgiveness and Love
sub_scenes.description: The conflict transitions from physical to spiritual as another man intervenes, guiding Vincent Matthews towards redemption through his sister's forgiveness and love.

narrative_arcs.title: Questioning Violence and Nature of Fear
Confession and Desperate Plea for Love
Physical Restraint and Assertion of Power
Summoning Rosalind and the Opportunity for Redemption
Request for Forgiveness and Millennial Release
Demand for Brotherly Love and Ultimate Freedom

sub_scenes.title: Departure and Resolution
sub_scenes.description: The spirits find peace and depart, and Northrup ensures the old man's safety, resolving the immediate supernatural issue at the estate.

Major_Arcs.title: Henry Hudson's Arctic Misfortune
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc recounts the historical tragedy of Henry Hudson's final voyage, from his commission to find the Northwest Passage to his mutiny and abandonment in the Arctic.

sub_scenes.title: Commission and Voyage Preparation
sub_scenes.description: The narrative introduces Henry Hudson and his commission by the Dutch East India Company to find the Northwest Passage to China.

narrative_arcs.title: The Strange Fate of Henry Hudson

sub_scenes.title: Voyage and False Hope
sub_scenes.description: Hudson's voyage begins, facing crew discontent and a false hope with the Hudson River, ultimately leading to disappointment.

narrative_arcs.title: Weeks at Sea and Crew's Discontent
Hudson's Reflection on Failure and Decision to Return Home

sub_scenes.title: Arctic Winter and Mutiny
sub_scenes.description: A new voyage leads to disaster as Hudson's ship becomes trapped in ice, culminating in mutiny and his abandonment.

narrative_arcs.title: Setting Up a New Voyage for the Northwest Passage
Ship Stuck in Ice and Winter Quarters
Ice Melts and Crew's Demand to Return Home
Forced Adrift and Abandonment of Hudson

sub_scenes.title: Mutineers' Justice
sub_scenes.description: The mutineers return home, facing immediate arrest and justice for their actions against Hudson.

narrative_arcs.title: Arrest of the Mutineers Upon Return

Major_Arcs.title: Hassan the Arabian Knight's Rescue Mission
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc follows Hassan, the Arabian Knight, on a perilous mission to rescue a kidnapped woman from Tartar horsemen, culminating in a trial by combat and a romantic reward.

sub_scenes.title: The Kidnapping and Mission Briefing
sub_scenes.description: The narrative opens with a chase and quickly transitions to Hassan receiving his mission from the Caliph to rescue a kidnapped woman.

narrative_arcs.title: The Chase and Introduction of Conflict
The Caliph's Summons and Mission Briefing
Setting off to Confront the Tartars

sub_scenes.title: Journey and Ominous Warnings
sub_scenes.description: Hassan's journey to the Tartar camp is fraught with danger and warnings, as he seeks information and encounters a fearful traveler.

narrative_arcs.title: Journey and Anticipation of the Oasis
Discovery of Tartar Tracks at the Oasis
Encounter with a Traveler and Dire Warning

sub_scenes.title: Infiltration and Capture
sub_scenes.description: Hassan infiltrates the Tartar camp, subduing a sentry and locating the kidnapped woman, but is soon discovered and captured.

narrative_arcs.title: Ambush and Subjugation of the Sentry
Inside the Tartar Camp - Search Begins
Suspicion and Confrontation by Tartar Guards

sub_scenes.title: Trial by Combat and Reward
sub_scenes.description: Hassan faces Kurgan's challenge of trial by combat, agrees to the terms, and prepares for a fight for his life and the woman's freedom.

narrative_arcs.title: The Contest Begins and Hassan's Dirt Strategy
Hassan's Victory Over Two Tartar Warriors
Kurgan Honors His Word and Departs
Questioning Hassan's Affection and a Blush
A Farewell Kiss and a Fine Reward
